doc.field: New York University Archives Collection of NYU Presidential Portraits
New York University Archives Collection of NYU Presidential Portraits

From 1831-2023, 16 men have acted as the Chancellor or President of New York University. The New York University Archives Collection of NYU Presidential Portraits consists of portraits representing people who have held this title.

From 1831-2023, 16 men have acted as the Chancellor or President of New York University. The New York University Archives Collection of NYU Presidential Portraits consists of portraits representing people who have held this title.

The New York University Archives Collection of NYU Presidential Portraits (dated circa 1831-2023) consists of 16 portraits representing people who have held the title of Chancellor or President of NYU.

From 1831-2023, 16 men have acted as the Chancellor or President of New York University. Beginning in 1831, the top-ranking office was titled Chancellor. In 1956, the Office of the President was created as the chief administrative post.

Many of the portraits were commissioned by the University; they were stored and displayed in various locations across campus, most recently in the Mamdouha S. Bobst Gallery in Bobst Library. They were transferred to the NYU Archives in February 2023. The accession number associated with this transfer is 2023.009.
Originals are not available due to fragility and exhibition; use photographed copies.
